name: pwnat
description: Proxy server that works behind a NAT

repo.name: pwnat
repo.description: The only tool/technique to punch holes through firewalls/NATs where multiple clients & server can be behind separate NATs without any 3rd party involvement. Pwnat is a newly developed technique, exploiting a property of NAT translation tables, with no 3rd party, port forwarding, DMZ, DNS, router admin requirements, STUN/TURN/UPnP/ICE, or spoofing.

readme.summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides a good understanding of the package's functionality, but lacks installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.

injection_risks.description: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in sprintf function
Use of gethostbyname function which can lead to DNS spoofing attacks

critical_findings: Lack of input validation for command line arguments
security.summary: The code has several security concerns, including potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which need to be addressed to ensure the security of the UDP tunnel server.

sentiment.summary: The community is moderately engaged but faces challenges with Windows support and insufficient documentation.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides detailed and technical responses, though there is room for more clarity in some points.

concerns: No open PRs, indicating a lack of new features or bug fixes being proposed.
A single merged PR in the past six months suggests limited community contribution.
positive_signals: Recent commits within the last year indicate some level of activity.
Two contributors have been active in the past six months, showing that there is still some engagement.
maintenance.summary: The package shows minimal maintenance with recent activity but lacks new contributions and open issues/PRs.
